resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Quant li varleiz s'esvella, il monstra sa jambe toute sainne et redist aus gens sa vision. Et trouva on sa jambe pourrie delez le corps. Ciz mirascles fu essauciez ou païs. Et loa on Nostre Segneur par mie saint Cosme et saint Damien.
resource.chars: Quant li varleiz s'esvella, il monstra sa jambe toute sainne et redist aus gens sa vision. Et trouva on sa jambe pourrie delez le corps. Ciz mirascles fu essauciez ou païs. Et loa on Nostre Segneur par mie saint Cosme et saint Damien.

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M2843.99452,1324.84972h908.59754v0h908.59754v163.90212v163.90212h-908.59754h-908.59754v-163.90212z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":3,"rotation":0,"deleteIcon":null,"rotationIcon":null,"group":null,"editable":true,"annotation":null}" id="rectangle_9dac0b58-2a3c-4c1d-9557-5687157f05c2" fill-opacity="0" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#000000" stroke-width="3" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Not being in virtue and the spiritual realm (which enable obtaining eternal life), the signs found on the corpses of the damned are not signs of life but rather signs of death. Indeed, sin leads to a double death. The first is of a spiritual nature caused by the rupture of the imaginary link between man and God. The second is of a physical nature, related to the confusion between the soul and the body, resulting in their separation at the moment of death. This image effectively illustrates this system of separation linked to sin. Indeed, the image shows the decaying leg of a sick person outside the coffin (located in the cemetery) even though the narrative indicates that it is placed inside the beer. This emphasizes that sinners do not belong to the same community, that they are excluded, and that they will experience eternal death.
resource.chars: Not being in virtue and the spiritual realm (which enable obtaining eternal life), the signs found on the corpses of the damned are not signs of life but rather signs of death. Indeed, sin leads to a double death. The first is of a spiritual nature caused by the rupture of the imaginary link between man and God. The second is of a physical nature, related to the confusion between the soul and the body, resulting in their separation at the moment of death. This image effectively illustrates this system of separation linked to sin. Indeed, the image shows the decaying leg of a sick person outside the coffin (located in the cemetery) even though the narrative indicates that it is placed inside the beer. This emphasizes that sinners do not belong to the same community, that they are excluded, and that they will experience eternal death.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The marginalized corpse. It emphasizes the theme of the Fall, damnation, the loss of resemblance to God, and eternal death
resource.chars: The marginalized corpse. It emphasizes the theme of the Fall, damnation, the loss of resemblance to God, and eternal death

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The marginalized corpse, yet showing signs of life. This representation serves to underline the mediocrity of the human condition while indicating the possibility of elevation
resource.chars: The marginalized corpse, yet showing signs of life. This representation serves to underline the mediocrity of the human condition while indicating the possibility of elevation

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M2442.60416,1399.09926h-404.70655v0h-404.70655v-371.03796v-371.03796h404.70655h404.70655v371.03796z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":3,"rotation":0,"annotation":null,"nonHoverStrokeColor":["Color",1,0,1],"editable":true}" id="rectangle_c3fcea82-786f-435a-955e-db66a743d188" fill-opacity="0.00001" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#ff00ff" stroke-width="68.57143" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Le mot corps/cors est utilisé pour désigner les dépouilles des saints. En atteste le chapitre de « l’exemple des saints » du Ci nous dit où tous les récits mettant en scène un cadavre de saint emploient ce mot. <span style="background-color: transparent; font-size: medium;">’<span style="background-color: transparent; font-size: medium; font-family: Liberation Serif, serif;">est également ce terme qui est utilisé pour le mort ayant été impliqué ou que l’on souhaite impliquer dans diverses pratiques funéraires. <span style="font-family: 'Liberation Serif', serif; background-color: transparent; font-size: medium;">Il s’avère aussi que <em style="font-family: 'Liberation Serif', serif; background-color: transparent; font-size: medium;">cors<span style="font-family: 'Liberation Serif', serif; background-color: transparent; font-size: medium;">/<em style="font-family: 'Liberation Serif', serif; background-color: transparent; font-size: medium;">corps<span style="font-family: 'Liberation Serif', serif; background-color: transparent; font-size: medium;"> soit appliqué dans les historiettes où le rapport corps/âme est mis en scène.
resource.chars: Le mot corps/cors est utilisé pour désigner les dépouilles des saints. En atteste le chapitre de « l’exemple des saints » du Ci nous dit où tous les récits mettant en scène un cadavre de saint emploient ce mot. ’est également ce terme qui est utilisé pour le mort ayant été impliqué ou que l’on souhaite impliquer dans diverses pratiques funéraires. Il s’avère aussi que cors/corps soit appliqué dans les historiettes où le rapport corps/âme est mis en scène.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Ci nous dit conment saint Cosme et saint Damien couperent de nuit la jambe a un meshengnié pour ce que a eulz s'estoit reconmandez. Et li ratacherent la jambe d'un corps qu'en avoit mis nouvellement en un cimentiere ; et mistrent la jambe pourrie delez le corps
resource.chars: Ci nous dit conment saint Cosme et saint Damien couperent de nuit la jambe a un meshengnié pour ce que a eulz s'estoit reconmandez. Et li ratacherent la jambe d'un corps qu'en avoit mis nouvellement en un cimentiere ; et mistrent la jambe pourrie delez le corps
